post.body_html:
This is the story of the Ruqqus corrective project and its involvement in the greatest troll op in Ruqqus History. If you're too lazy or lack the brainpower to read through this, i would recommend checking out this video: https://youtu.be/xvFZjo5PgG0

If this isn't your cup of tea, downvote and move on. Unless you have some creative insults to drop other than fag, shill, tranny, retard, nig, troll, etc. I'm telling you this story for the first time, so I would at least expect some new insults for the first time. Ruqqus users are famous for their stubborn consistency and a lack of willingness to change their language or beliefs. Can you prove me wrong? Because this stubbornness to accept other opinions and unwillingness to listen to logic is what lead to this drama in the first place.

Precursor

A group of users gathered together on election day to create a revolutionary guild to troll the few other users on this site. This guild was +The_DonaId, where any dissenting opinions were banned (quite similar to a certain meme guild we all know of). As of now, it boasts 250+ members. However, these users wanted more, and they would lay the foundation for the creation of the RCP.

The Beginning

It all started out with me (@Emerald41) and a couple of other Ruqqus guildmasters leaving random quotes that were really bizarre out of context. I had the idea of taking screenshots of these out of context quotes and putting them together to post them in +TheMemery. Before I posted it however, users @carpathianflorist and @EmbraceTheMonke gave me some memes and advice to prep my alt account, @Sion321, to make the account look more trustworthy. Once the account was ready, the collage was posted, and we waited to see if anyone would fall for it.

And fall for it they did. https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5c0y/milkit-predicted-this-evidence-of-many

The post got 120+ upvotes in +TheMemery, and many people fell for it. A majority of the people that denied it in the comments were downvoted and/or banned from the guild. Overall, it was a massive success. I was considering ending it there, but other GMs seeing its success, also wanted to capitalize on this one-of-a-kind opportunity.

RCP involvement

After seeing the operation's success, user @carpathianflorist decided to create a Discord server just for trolling +TheMemery. This became the Ruqqus Corrective Project Discord server. 20+ Gms were added to this Discord, many of whom provided great contributions to the cause. Within a week, I had enough screenshots to make another collage of out of context quotes and posted them to +TheMemery again.

Once again, +TheMemery fell for it hard: https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5ee9/more-evidence-of-ahs-involvement-on

For the next part, we decided to leak the RCP server invite so that skeptics could get their own screenshots as evidence. We pretended to be clueless, but in fact, it was all a ruse to give people time to get their "evidence." Now, it was practically undeniable that the "cabal" existed since multiple users now had "evidence".

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5lsh/urgent-ccpahs-discord-link-has-been

Final Phase

After a while, we decided it was time to bring the RCP to a close. We had our fun, but we wanted to go out with a bang. Over time, we picked up even more users. The most prominent among these were devs @Seq37 & @acikek, and site admin @kek who joined a day before the finale. I asked Seq and Acikek to to DM me saying that they will deactivate Sion321 if I don't delete my previous "bombshells." I took screenshots of these DMs and created the final collage and posted them to +TheMemery

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5qyy/two-code-contributors-of-some-sort

The post sparked a lot of controversy, and @milkit (GM of +TheMemery) was suspicious. To allay his suspicions, @Seq37 gave me the idea of spamming comments in one of his private guilds to trigger the anti-spam system to ban @Sion321. Needless to say, +TheMemery freaked out, and users demanded statements from site admins for a reason why Sion was banned. Site admin @kek came in first and told the guild all about the RCP and how I intentionally got Sion321 banned by spamming. The users (including milkit) denied all of it, lashing out at Kek, calling him a liar and incompetent among other things. Very few people believed it, until site admin @captainmeta4 came in and confirmed everything Kek had said.

Edit - Adding this link: https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5r1h/so-sion123-was-threatened-with-a

The aftermath

@milkit, realizing he had been played hard, started to again lash out against the admins calling them trolls and whatnot. Desperately grasping for straws, he found an out-of-context comment by Carp saying that I was a young girl. Ironic considering all this drama was caused because of out-of-context screenshots. Using Carp's comment as evidence, milkit accused @carpathianflorist and @kek of being pedos trying to groom me.

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5rcc/omg-its-even-more-pathetic-than

I'm not gonna reveal my age, but I will say I'm older than 18, so already that claim is false. Also, neither Carp nor Kek have any romantic interest in me, and I don't have any romantic interest in them. This was just milkit's attempt to deflect attention from himself after being humiliated in his own circlejerk which we colloquially call +TheMemery.

https://i.ruqqus.com/post/5rnd/EVqVQFr2__g

Legacy of the RCP

And now we find ourselves at the present. Much of +TheMemery is still in denial and some guilds (Such as +BasedMemes) are taking precautionary measures against threats that don't even exist. We sucessfully managed to convince a good portion of the site that shills, the CCP, & AHS are active forces on Ruqqus.

However, if you take a step back, you can easily tell all of this was a grand ruse. The CCP and AHS aren't interested in an obscure forum in which Discord screenshots and 4chan posts are used as evidence. The word "shill" has been thrown around so much that its lost its meaning. The only genuine shill (by definition) on this site is that TEFL reposter.

If you want a more deep analysis of the moral of this saga, I would reccomend giving @AsininePorcupine's post a read: https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/5s60/the-difference-between-trolls-and-shills

Now that our fun is over, the RCP has decided to come to a close. The Ruqqus Corrective Project will no longer be operational. However all this begs the question...

Why did the RCP do this?

Just about everyone has varying reasons for joining/participating in the RCP. Some just wanted a chance to get back at milkit. Others just thought it looked liked fun. Others wanted to prove a point. Some users wanted a way to leave Ruqqus with a bang.

I personally did it to prove a point: How disastrous exclusively staying inside an echo chamber (such as the memery) is.

How much time was put into the RCP?

It varies between users, but overall most users put in a grand total of 2 hours or less. The more active RCP members (such as Carp, myself, and a couple others) put in a total of about 4 hours. So really, this wasn't a high effort campaign. Makes it all the more bizarre that people fell for it in the first place.

Notable Contributors

I did not do this all on my own. There were numerous contributors to this cause that helped make it successful. Among these notable contributors are:

@AsininePorcupine @no_chill @carpathianflorist @EmbraceTheMonke @Seq37 @acikek @kek @SomeoneAtThePhone @Bidpots @VILLAIN @freeday @notabot @Regmadan @l1terally_h1tler

As for the other RCP members, if you want to chime in to assert your association with our glorious project, go ahead.
post.title: The grand story of the RCP and the greatest troll op in Ruqqus history

body:
Before I criticise the fuck out of this, I think its commendable you spent time writing this to explain what happened. having said that...

>If you're too lazy or lack the brainpower to read through this

This is off to a great start...

>A group of users gathered together on election day to create a revolutionary guild

Delusions of grandeur?

>A majority of the people that denied it in the comments were downvoted and/or banned from the guild.

I denied it. Was not banned.

>was considering ending it there, but other GMs seeing its success, also wanted to capitalize on this one-of-a-kind opportunity.

Can you elaborate who? **Can you also say if the timing of the first Sion post was your choice or if someone else suggested that day?**

>The users (including milkit) denied all of it, lashing out at Kek, calling him a liar and incompetent among other things. Very few people believed it, until site admin @captainmeta4 came in and confirmed everything Kek had said.

This distrust and disbelief mostly stemmed from the recent @Klenvastergan ban... reasonably so. Other users expressed doubt about the admins integrity stemming from other bans and exiles, though I don't know enough about these to say if they're justified in their criticism.

>Using Carp's comment as evidence, milkit accused @carpathianflorist and @kek of being pedos trying to groom me

Any proof of this accusation?

>I personally did it to prove a point: How disastrous exclusively staying inside an echo chamber (such as the memery) is.

If TheMemery and other guilds are echo chambers, so are yours likely to be...

Before I criticise the fuck out of this, I think its commendable you spent time writing this to explain what happened. having said that...

If you're too lazy or lack the brainpower to read through this

This is off to a great start...

A group of users gathered together on election day to create a revolutionary guild

Delusions of grandeur?

A majority of the people that denied it in the comments were downvoted and/or banned from the guild.

I denied it. Was not banned.

was considering ending it there, but other GMs seeing its success, also wanted to capitalize on this one-of-a-kind opportunity.

Can you elaborate who? Can you also say if the timing of the first Sion post was your choice or if someone else suggested that day?

The users (including milkit) denied all of it, lashing out at Kek, calling him a liar and incompetent among other things. Very few people believed it, until site admin @captainmeta4 came in and confirmed everything Kek had said.

This distrust and disbelief mostly stemmed from the recent @klenvastergan ban... reasonably so. Other users expressed doubt about the admins integrity stemming from other bans and exiles, though I don't know enough about these to say if they're justified in their criticism.

Using Carp's comment as evidence, milkit accused @carpathianflorist and @kek of being pedos trying to groom me

Any proof of this accusation?

I personally did it to prove a point: How disastrous exclusively staying inside an echo chamber (such as the memery) is.

If TheMemery and other guilds are echo chambers, so are yours likely to be...

Needless to say, +TheMemery freaked out, and users demanded statements from site admins for a reason why Sion was banned. Site admin @kek came in first and told the guild all about the RCP and how I intentionally got Sion321 banned by spamming. The users (including milkit) denied all of it, lashing out at Kek, calling him a liar and incompetent among other things. Very few people believed it, until site admin @captainmeta4 came in and confirmed everything Kek had said.

Edit - Adding this link: https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5r1h/so-sion123-was-threatened-with-a

The aftermath

@milkit, realizing he had been played hard, started to again lash out against the admins calling them trolls and whatnot. Desperately grasping for straws, he found an out-of-context comment by Carp saying that I was a young girl. Ironic considering all this drama was caused because of out-of-context screenshots. Using Carp's comment as evidence, milkit accused @carpathianflorist and @kek of being pedos trying to groom me.

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5rcc/omg-its-even-more-pathetic-than

I'm not gonna reveal my age, but I will say I'm older than 18, so already that claim is false. Also, neither Carp nor Kek have any romantic interest in me, and I don't have any romantic interest in them. This was just milkit's attempt to deflect attention from himself after being humiliated in his own circlejerk which we colloquially call +TheMemery.

https://i.ruqqus.com/post/5rnd/EVqVQFr2__g

Legacy of the RCP

And now we find ourselves at the present. Much of +TheMemery is still in denial and some guilds (Such as +BasedMemes) are taking precautionary measures against threats that don't even exist. We sucessfully managed to convince a good portion of the site that shills, the CCP, & AHS are active forces on Ruqqus.

However, if you take a step back, you can easily tell all of this was a grand ruse. The CCP and AHS aren't interested in an obscure forum in which Discord screenshots and 4chan posts are used as evidence. The word "shill" has been thrown around so much that its lost its meaning. The only genuine shill (by definition) on this site is that TEFL reposter.

If you want a more deep analysis of the moral of this saga, I would reccomend giving @AsininePorcupine's post a read: https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/5s60/the-difference-between-trolls-and-shills

Now that our fun is over, the RCP has decided to come to a close. The Ruqqus Corrective Project will no longer be operational. However all this begs the question...

Why did the RCP do this?

Just about everyone has varying reasons for joining/participating in the RCP. Some just wanted a chance to get back at milkit. Others just thought it looked liked fun. Others wanted to prove a point. Some users wanted a way to leave Ruqqus with a bang.

I personally did it to prove a point: How disastrous exclusively staying inside an echo chamber (such as the memery) is.

How much time was put into the RCP?

It varies between users, but overall most users put in a grand total of 2 hours or less. The more active RCP members (such as Carp, myself, and a couple others) put in a total of about 4 hours. So really, this wasn't a high effort campaign. Makes it all the more bizarre that people fell for it in the first place.

Notable Contributors

I did not do this all on my own. There were numerous contributors to this cause that helped make it successful. Among these notable contributors are:

@AsininePorcupine @no_chill @carpathianflorist @EmbraceTheMonke @Seq37 @acikek @kek @SomeoneAtThePhone @Bidpots @VILLAIN @freeday @notabot @Regmadan @l1terally_h1tler

As for the other RCP members, if you want to chime in to assert your association with our glorious project, go ahead.
post.title: The grand story of the RCP and the greatest troll op in Ruqqus history

post.body_html:
This is the story of the Ruqqus corrective project and its involvement in the greatest troll op in Ruqqus History. If you're too lazy or lack the brainpower to read through this, i would recommend checking out this video: https://youtu.be/xvFZjo5PgG0

If this isn't your cup of tea, downvote and move on. Unless you have some creative insults to drop other than fag, shill, tranny, retard, nig, troll, etc. I'm telling you this story for the first time, so I would at least expect some new insults for the first time. Ruqqus users are famous for their stubborn consistency and a lack of willingness to change their language or beliefs. Can you prove me wrong? Because this stubbornness to accept other opinions and unwillingness to listen to logic is what lead to this drama in the first place.

Precursor

A group of users gathered together on election day to create a revolutionary guild to troll the few other users on this site. This guild was +The_DonaId, where any dissenting opinions were banned (quite similar to a certain meme guild we all know of). As of now, it boasts 250+ members. However, these users wanted more, and they would lay the foundation for the creation of the RCP.

The Beginning

It all started out with me (@Emerald41) and a couple of other Ruqqus guildmasters leaving random quotes that were really bizarre out of context. I had the idea of taking screenshots of these out of context quotes and putting them together to post them in +TheMemery. Before I posted it however, users @carpathianflorist and @EmbraceTheMonke gave me some memes and advice to prep my alt account, @Sion321, to make the account look more trustworthy. Once the account was ready, the collage was posted, and we waited to see if anyone would fall for it.

And fall for it they did. https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5c0y/milkit-predicted-this-evidence-of-many

The post got 120+ upvotes in +TheMemery, and many people fell for it. A majority of the people that denied it in the comments were downvoted and/or banned from the guild. Overall, it was a massive success. I was considering ending it there, but other GMs seeing its success, also wanted to capitalize on this one-of-a-kind opportunity.

RCP involvement

After seeing the operation's success, user @carpathianflorist decided to create a Discord server just for trolling +TheMemery. This became the Ruqqus Corrective Project Discord server. 20+ Gms were added to this Discord, many of whom provided great contributions to the cause. Within a week, I had enough screenshots to make another collage of out of context quotes and posted them to +TheMemery again.

Once again, +TheMemery fell for it hard: https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5ee9/more-evidence-of-ahs-involvement-on

For the next part, we decided to leak the RCP server invite so that skeptics could get their own screenshots as evidence. We pretended to be clueless, but in fact, it was all a ruse to give people time to get their "evidence." Now, it was practically undeniable that the "cabal" existed since multiple users now had "evidence".

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5lsh/urgent-ccpahs-discord-link-has-been

Final Phase

After a while, we decided it was time to bring the RCP to a close. We had our fun, but we wanted to go out with a bang. Over time, we picked up even more users. The most prominent among these were devs @Seq37 & @acikek, and site admin @kek who joined a day before the finale. I asked Seq and Acikek to to DM me saying that they will deactivate Sion321 if I don't delete my previous "bombshells." I took screenshots of these DMs and created the final collage and posted them to +TheMemery

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5qyy/two-code-contributors-of-some-sort

The post sparked a lot of controversy, and @milkit (GM of +TheMemery) was suspicious. To allay his suspicions, @Seq37 gave me the idea of spamming comments in one of his private guilds to trigger the anti-spam system to ban @Sion321. Needless to say, +TheMemery freaked out, and users demanded statements from site admins for a reason why Sion was banned. Site admin @kek came in first and told the guild all about the RCP and how I intentionally got Sion321 banned by spamming. The users (including milkit) denied all of it, lashing out at Kek, calling him a liar and incompetent among other things. Very few people believed it, until site admin @captainmeta4 came in and confirmed everything Kek had said.

Edit - Adding this link: https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5r1h/so-sion123-was-threatened-with-a

The aftermath

@milkit, realizing he had been played hard, started to again lash out against the admins calling them trolls and whatnot. Desperately grasping for straws, he found an out-of-context comment by Carp saying that I was a young girl. Ironic considering all this drama was caused because of out-of-context screenshots. Using Carp's comment as evidence, milkit accused @carpathianflorist and @kek of being pedos trying to groom me.

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5rcc/omg-its-even-more-pathetic-than

I'm not gonna reveal my age, but I will say I'm older than 18, so already that claim is false. Also, neither Carp nor Kek have any romantic interest in me, and I don't have any romantic interest in them. This was just milkit's attempt to deflect attention from himself after being humiliated in his own circlejerk which we colloquially call +TheMemery.

https://i.ruqqus.com/post/5rnd/EVqVQFr2__g

Legacy of the RCP

And now we find ourselves at the present. Much of +TheMemery is still in denial and some guilds (Such as +BasedMemes) are taking precautionary measures against threats that don't even exist. We sucessfully managed to convince a good portion of the site that shills, the CCP, & AHS are active forces on Ruqqus.

However, if you take a step back, you can easily tell all of this was a grand ruse. The CCP and AHS aren't interested in an obscure forum in which Discord screenshots and 4chan posts are used as evidence. The word "shill" has been thrown around so much that its lost its meaning. The only genuine shill (by definition) on this site is that TEFL reposter.

If you want a more deep analysis of the moral of this saga, I would reccomend giving @AsininePorcupine's post a read: https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/5s60/the-difference-between-trolls-and-shills

Now that our fun is over, the RCP has decided to come to a close. The Ruqqus Corrective Project will no longer be operational. However all this begs the question...

Why did the RCP do this?

Just about everyone has varying reasons for joining/participating in the RCP. Some just wanted a chance to get back at milkit. Others just thought it looked liked fun. Others wanted to prove a point. Some users wanted a way to leave Ruqqus with a bang.

I personally did it to prove a point: How disastrous exclusively staying inside an echo chamber (such as the memery) is.

How much time was put into the RCP?

It varies between users, but overall most users put in a grand total of 2 hours or less. The more active RCP members (such as Carp, myself, and a couple others) put in a total of about 4 hours. Edit - Adding this link: https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5r1h/so-sion123-was-threatened-with-a

The aftermath

@milkit, realizing he had been played hard, started to again lash out against the admins calling them trolls and whatnot. Desperately grasping for straws, he found an out-of-context comment by Carp saying that I was a young girl. Ironic considering all this drama was caused because of out-of-context screenshots. Using Carp's comment as evidence, milkit accused @carpathianflorist and @kek of being pedos trying to groom me.

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5rcc/omg-its-even-more-pathetic-than

I'm not gonna reveal my age, but I will say I'm older than 18, so already that claim is false. Also, neither Carp nor Kek have any romantic interest in me, and I don't have any romantic interest in them. This was just milkit's attempt to deflect attention from himself after being humiliated in his own circlejerk which we colloquially call +TheMemery.

https://i.ruqqus.com/post/5rnd/EVqVQFr2__g

Legacy of the RCP

And now we find ourselves at the present. Much of +TheMemery is still in denial and some guilds (Such as +BasedMemes) are taking precautionary measures against threats that don't even exist. We sucessfully managed to convince a good portion of the site that shills, the CCP, & AHS are active forces on Ruqqus.

However, if you take a step back, you can easily tell all of this was a grand ruse. The CCP and AHS aren't interested in an obscure forum in which Discord screenshots and 4chan posts are used as evidence. The word "shill" has been thrown around so much that its lost its meaning. The only genuine shill (by definition) on this site is that TEFL reposter.

If you want a more deep analysis of the moral of this saga, I would reccomend giving @AsininePorcupine's post a read: https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/5s60/the-difference-between-trolls-and-shills

Now that our fun is over, the RCP has decided to come to a close. The Ruqqus Corrective Project will no longer be operational. However all this begs the question...

Why did the RCP do this?

Just about everyone has varying reasons for joining/participating in the RCP. Some just wanted a chance to get back at milkit. Others just thought it looked liked fun. Others wanted to prove a point. Some users wanted a way to leave Ruqqus with a bang.

I personally did it to prove a point: How disastrous exclusively staying inside an echo chamber (such as the memery) is.

How much time was put into the RCP?

It varies between users, but overall most users put in a grand total of 2 hours or less. The more active RCP members (such as Carp, myself, and a couple others) put in a total of about 4 hours. So really, this wasn't a high effort campaign. Makes it all the more bizarre that people fell for it in the first place.

Notable Contributors

I did not do this all on my own. There were numerous contributors to this cause that helped make it successful. Among these notable contributors are:

@AsininePorcupine @no_chill @carpathianflorist @EmbraceTheMonke @Seq37 @acikek @kek @SomeoneAtThePhone @Bidpots @VILLAIN @freeday @notabot @Regmadan @l1terally_h1tler

As for the other RCP members, if you want to chime in to assert your association with our glorious project, go ahead.
post.title: The grand story of the RCP and the greatest troll op in Ruqqus history

author.ban_reason: using alts to circumvent siege cooldown

body:
Answering as my alt so I can pull up my posts faster

> Delusions of grandeur?

Not even a GM of the guild, but ok. 

> Can you elaborate who? Can you also say if the timing of the first Sion post was your choice or if someone else suggested that day?

Some of the users preferred to remain anon, & I respect their privacy. 

Originally, I wanted to post the collage three days beforehand, but Carp and @EmbracetheMonke recommended I build up rep on this account to make this account look more trustworthy, so I posted some of the memes Carp gave me and I built up 300+ rep in 3 days. 

> Any proof of this accusation?

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5rcc/omg-its-even-more-pathetic-than

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5qyy/two-code-contributors-of-some-sort/jxwp

> If TheMemery and other guilds are echo chambers, so are yours likely to be...

Whether or not +Wholesome, +AmongUs, & +AskOuija are echo chambers are debatable. However, I've only had to ban about 6 users in total across all these guilds, compared to +TheMemery's what? 100? 200? I'm not using any of my guilds to push narratives or political standpoints either, but I digress.

Thank you for actually challenging my stories. Its not that often I get to have actual discussions without it devolving into name calling.

post.body_html:
This is the story of the Ruqqus corrective project and its involvement in the greatest troll op in Ruqqus History. If you're too lazy or lack the brainpower to read through this, i would recommend checking out this video: https://youtu.be/xvFZjo5PgG0

If this isn't your cup of tea, downvote and move on. Unless you have some creative insults to drop other than fag, shill, tranny, retard, nig, troll, etc. I'm telling you this story for the first time, so I would at least expect some new insults for the first time. Ruqqus users are famous for their stubborn consistency and a lack of willingness to change their language or beliefs. Can you prove me wrong? Because this stubbornness to accept other opinions and unwillingness to listen to logic is what lead to this drama in the first place.

Precursor

A group of users gathered together on election day to create a revolutionary guild to troll the few other users on this site. This guild was +The_DonaId, where any dissenting opinions were banned (quite similar to a certain meme guild we all know of). As of now, it boasts 250+ members. However, these users wanted more, and they would lay the foundation for the creation of the RCP.

The Beginning

It all started out with me (@Emerald41) and a couple of other Ruqqus guildmasters leaving random quotes that were really bizarre out of context. I had the idea of taking screenshots of these out of context quotes and putting them together to post them in +TheMemery. Before I posted it however, users @carpathianflorist and @EmbraceTheMonke gave me some memes and advice to prep my alt account, @Sion321, to make the account look more trustworthy. Once the account was ready, the collage was posted, and we waited to see if anyone would fall for it.

And fall for it they did. https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5c0y/milkit-predicted-this-evidence-of-many

The post got 120+ upvotes in +TheMemery, and many people fell for it. A majority of the people that denied it in the comments were downvoted and/or banned from the guild. Overall, it was a massive success. I was considering ending it there, but other GMs seeing its success, also wanted to capitalize on this one-of-a-kind opportunity.

RCP involvement

After seeing the operation's success, user @carpathianflorist decided to create a Discord server just for trolling +TheMemery. This became the Ruqqus Corrective Project Discord server. 20+ Gms were added to this Discord, many of whom provided great contributions to the cause. Within a week, I had enough screenshots to make another collage of out of context quotes and posted them to +TheMemery again.

Once again, +TheMemery fell for it hard: https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5ee9/more-evidence-of-ahs-involvement-on

For the next part, we decided to leak the RCP server invite so that skeptics could get their own screenshots as evidence. We pretended to be clueless, but in fact, it was all a ruse to give people time to get their "evidence." Now, it was practically undeniable that the "cabal" existed since multiple users now had "evidence".

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5lsh/urgent-ccpahs-discord-link-has-been

Final Phase

After a while, we decided it was time to bring the RCP to a close. We had our fun, but we wanted to go out with a bang. Over time, we picked up even more users. The most prominent among these were devs @Seq37 & @acikek, and site admin @kek who joined a day before the finale. I asked Seq and Acikek to to DM me saying that they will deactivate Sion321 if I don't delete my previous "bombshells." I took screenshots of these DMs and created the final collage and posted them to +TheMemery

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5qyy/two-code-contributors-of-some-sort

The post sparked a lot of controversy, and @milkit (GM of +TheMemery) was suspicious. To allay his suspicions, @Seq37 gave me the idea of spamming comments in one of his private guilds to trigger the anti-spam system to ban @Sion321. Needless to say, +TheMemery freaked out, and users demanded statements from site admins for a reason why Sion was banned. Site admin @kek came in first and told the guild all about the RCP and how I intentionally got Sion321 banned by spamming. The users (including milkit) denied all of it, lashing out at Kek, calling him a liar and incompetent among other things. Very few people believed it, until site admin @captainmeta4 came in and confirmed everything Kek had said.

Edit - Adding this link: https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5r1h/so-sion123-was-threatened-with-a

The aftermath

@milkit, realizing he had been played hard, started to again lash out against the admins calling them trolls and whatnot. Desperately grasping for straws, he found an out-of-context comment by Carp saying that I was a young girl. Ironic considering all this drama was caused because of out-of-context screenshots. Using Carp's comment as evidence, milkit accused @carpathianflorist and @kek of being pedos trying to groom me.

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5rcc/omg-its-even-more-pathetic-than

I'm not gonna reveal my age, but I will say I'm older than 18, so already that claim is false. Also, neither Carp nor Kek have any romantic interest in me, and I don't have any romantic interest in them. This was just milkit's attempt to deflect attention from himself after being humiliated in his own circlejerk which we colloquially call +TheMemery.

https://i.ruqqus.com/post/5rnd/EVqVQFr2__g

Legacy of the RCP

And now we find ourselves at the present. Much of +TheMemery is still in denial and some guilds (Such as +BasedMemes) are taking precautionary measures against threats that don't even exist. We sucessfully managed to convince a good portion of the site that shills, the CCP, & AHS are active forces on Ruqqus.

However, if you take a step back, you can easily tell all of this was a grand ruse. The CCP and AHS aren't interested in an obscure forum in which Discord screenshots and 4chan posts are used as evidence. The word "shill" has been thrown around so much that its lost its meaning. The only genuine shill (by definition) on this site is that TEFL reposter.

If you want a more deep analysis of the moral of this saga, I would reccomend giving @AsininePorcupine's post a read: https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/5s60/the-difference-between-trolls-and-shills

Now that our fun is over, the RCP has decided to come to a close. The Ruqqus Corrective Project will no longer be operational. However all this begs the question...

Why did the RCP do this?

Just about everyone has varying reasons for joining/participating in the RCP. Some just wanted a chance to get back at milkit. Others just thought it looked liked fun. Others wanted to prove a point. Some users wanted a way to leave Ruqqus with a bang.

I personally did it to prove a point: How disastrous exclusively staying inside an echo chamber (such as the memery) is.

How much time was put into the RCP?

It varies between users, but overall most users put in a grand total of 2 hours or less. The more active RCP members (such as Carp, myself, and a couple others) put in a total of about 4 hours. So really, this wasn't a high effort campaign. Makes it all the more bizarre that people fell for it in the first place.

Notable Contributors

I did not do this all on my own. There were numerous contributors to this cause that helped make it successful. Among these notable contributors are:

@AsininePorcupine @no_chill @carpathianflorist @EmbraceTheMonke @Seq37 @acikek @kek @SomeoneAtThePhone @Bidpots @VILLAIN @freeday @notabot @Regmadan @l1terally_h1tler

As for the other RCP members, if you want to chime in to assert your association with our glorious project, go ahead.

post.body_html:
This is the story of the Ruqqus corrective project and its involvement in the greatest troll op in Ruqqus History. If you're too lazy or lack the brainpower to read through this, i would recommend checking out this video: https://youtu.be/xvFZjo5PgG0

If this isn't your cup of tea, downvote and move on. Unless you have some creative insults to drop other than fag, shill, tranny, retard, nig, troll, etc. I'm telling you this story for the first time, so I would at least expect some new insults for the first time. Ruqqus users are famous for their stubborn consistency and a lack of willingness to change their language or beliefs. Can you prove me wrong? Because this stubbornness to accept other opinions and unwillingness to listen to logic is what lead to this drama in the first place.

Precursor

A group of users gathered together on election day to create a revolutionary guild to troll the few other users on this site. This guild was +The_DonaId, where any dissenting opinions were banned (quite similar to a certain meme guild we all know of). As of now, it boasts 250+ members. However, these users wanted more, and they would lay the foundation for the creation of the RCP.

The Beginning

It all started out with me (@Emerald41) and a couple of other Ruqqus guildmasters leaving random quotes that were really bizarre out of context. I had the idea of taking screenshots of these out of context quotes and putting them together to post them in +TheMemery. Before I posted it however, users @carpathianflorist and @EmbraceTheMonke gave me some memes and advice to prep my alt account, @Sion321, to make the account look more trustworthy. Once the account was ready, the collage was posted, and we waited to see if anyone would fall for it.

And fall for it they did. https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5c0y/milkit-predicted-this-evidence-of-many

The post got 120+ upvotes in +TheMemery, and many people fell for it. A majority of the people that denied it in the comments were downvoted and/or banned from the guild. Overall, it was a massive success. I was considering ending it there, but other GMs seeing its success, also wanted to capitalize on this one-of-a-kind opportunity.

RCP involvement

After seeing the operation's success, user @carpathianflorist decided to create a Discord server just for trolling +TheMemery. This became the Ruqqus Corrective Project Discord server. 20+ Gms were added to this Discord, many of whom provided great contributions to the cause. Within a week, I had enough screenshots to make another collage of out of context quotes and posted them to +TheMemery again.

Once again, +TheMemery fell for it hard: https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5ee9/more-evidence-of-ahs-involvement-on

For the next part, we decided to leak the RCP server invite so that skeptics could get their own screenshots as evidence. We pretended to be clueless, but in fact, it was all a ruse to give people time to get their "evidence." Now, it was practically undeniable that the "cabal" existed since multiple users now had "evidence".

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5lsh/urgent-ccpahs-discord-link-has-been

Final Phase

After a while, we decided it was time to bring the RCP to a close. We had our fun, but we wanted to go out with a bang. Over time, we picked up even more users. The most prominent among these were devs @Seq37 & @acikek, and site admin @kek who joined a day before the finale. I asked Seq and Acikek to to DM me saying that they will deactivate Sion321 if I don't delete my previous "bombshells." I took screenshots of these DMs and created the final collage and posted them to +TheMemery

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5qyy/two-code-contributors-of-some-sort

The post sparked a lot of controversy, and @milkit (GM of +TheMemery) was suspicious. To allay his suspicions, @Seq37 gave me the idea of spamming comments in one of his private guilds to trigger the anti-spam system to ban @Sion321. Needless to say, +TheMemery freaked out, and users demanded statements from site admins for a reason why Sion was banned. Site admin @kek came in first and told the guild all about the RCP and how I intentionally got Sion321 banned by spamming. The users (including milkit) denied all of it, lashing out at Kek, calling him a liar and incompetent among other things. Very few people believed it, until site admin @captainmeta4 came in and confirmed everything Kek had said.

Edit - Adding this link: https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5r1h/so-sion123-was-threatened-with-a

The aftermath

@milkit, realizing he had been played hard, started to again lash out against the admins calling them trolls and whatnot. Desperately grasping for straws, he found an out-of-context comment by Carp saying that I was a young girl. Ironic considering all this drama was caused because of out-of-context screenshots. Using Carp's comment as evidence, milkit accused @carpathianflorist and @kek of being pedos trying to groom me.

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5rcc/omg-its-even-more-pathetic-than

I'm not gonna reveal my age, but I will say I'm older than 18, so already that claim is false. Also, neither Carp nor Kek have any romantic interest in me, and I don't have any romantic interest in them. This was just milkit's attempt to deflect attention from himself after being humiliated in his own circlejerk which we colloquially call +TheMemery.

https://i.ruqqus.com/post/5rnd/EVqVQFr2__g

Legacy of the RCP

And now we find ourselves at the present. Much of +TheMemery is still in denial and some guilds (Such as +BasedMemes) are taking precautionary measures against threats that don't even exist. We sucessfully managed to convince a good portion of the site that shills, the CCP, & AHS are active forces on Ruqqus.

However, if you take a step back, you can easily tell all of this was a grand ruse. The CCP and AHS aren't interested in an obscure forum in which Discord screenshots and 4chan posts are used as evidence. The word "shill" has been thrown around so much that its lost its meaning. The only genuine shill (by definition) on this site is that TEFL reposter.

If you want a more deep analysis of the moral of this saga, I would reccomend giving @AsininePorcupine's post a read: https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/5s60/the-difference-between-trolls-and-shills

Now that our fun is over, the RCP has decided to come to a close. The Ruqqus Corrective Project will no longer be operational. However all this begs the question...

Why did the RCP do this?

Just about everyone has varying reasons for joining/participating in the RCP. Some just wanted a chance to get back at milkit. Others just thought it looked liked fun. Others wanted to prove a point. Some users wanted a way to leave Ruqqus with a bang.

I personally did it to prove a point: How disastrous exclusively staying inside an echo chamber (such as the memery) is.

How much time was put into the RCP?

It varies between users, but overall most users put in a grand total of 2 hours or less. The more active RCP members (such as Carp, myself, and a couple others) put in a total of about 4 hours. So really, this wasn't a high effort campaign. Makes it all the more bizarre that people fell for it in the first place.

Notable Contributors

I did not do this all on my own. There were numerous contributors to this cause that helped make it successful. Among these notable contributors are:

@AsininePorcupine @no_chill @carpathianflorist @EmbraceTheMonke @Seq37 @acikek @kek @SomeoneAtThePhone @Bidpots @VILLAIN @freeday @notabot @Regmadan @l1terally_h1tler

As for the other RCP members, if you want to chime in to assert your association with our glorious project, go ahead.
post.title: The grand story of the RCP and the greatest troll op in Ruqqus history

body:
>Not even a GM of the guild, but ok.

"revolutionary guild" sounds ridiculously dramatic... not unlike something I'd be known to say.

>Some of the users preferred to remain anon, & I respect their privacy.

Fair enough.

I'm not sure if I see evidence in those posts about milkit making false accusations... looks more like he went out of his way to clarify it was not what you're accusing him of.

Your guilds don't particularly look like echo chambers, but I'd say it's a reasonable guess that discord is a different matter. 

Narratives and political standpoints are what matters most to a lot of people - on either "side."

Narratives and political standpoints are what matters most to a lot of people - on either "side."

parent.body:
Answering as my alt so I can pull up my posts faster

> Delusions of grandeur?

Not even a GM of the guild, but ok. 

> Can you elaborate who? Can you also say if the timing of the first Sion post was your choice or if someone else suggested that day?

Some of the users preferred to remain anon, & I respect their privacy. 

Originally, I wanted to post the collage three days beforehand, but Carp and @EmbracetheMonke recommended I build up rep on this account to make this account look more trustworthy, so I posted some of the memes Carp gave me and I built up 300+ rep in 3 days. 

> Any proof of this accusation?

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5rcc/omg-its-even-more-pathetic-than

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5qyy/two-code-contributors-of-some-sort/jxwp

> If TheMemery and other guilds are echo chambers, so are yours likely to be...

Whether or not +Wholesome, +AmongUs, & +AskOuija are echo chambers are debatable. However, I've only had to ban about 6 users in total across all these guilds, compared to +TheMemery's what? 100? 200? I'm not using any of my guilds to push narratives or political standpoints either, but I digress.

Thank you for actually challenging my stories. Its not that often I get to have actual discussions without it devolving into name calling.
parent.body_html:
Answering as my alt so I can pull up my posts faster

Delusions of grandeur?

Not even a GM of the guild, but ok.

Can you elaborate who? Can you also say if the timing of the first Sion post was your choice or if someone else suggested that day?

Some of the users preferred to remain anon, & I respect their privacy.

Originally, I wanted to post the collage three days beforehand, but Carp and @EmbraceTheMonke recommended I build up rep on this account to make this account look more trustworthy, so I posted some of the memes Carp gave me and I built up 300+ rep in 3 days.

Any proof of this accusation?

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5rcc/omg-its-even-more-pathetic-than

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5qyy/two-code-contributors-of-some-sort/jxwp

If TheMemery and other guilds are echo chambers, so are yours likely to be...

Whether or not +Wholesome, +AmongUs, & +AskOuija are echo chambers are debatable. However, I've only had to ban about 6 users in total across all these guilds, compared to +TheMemery's what? 100? 200? I'm not using any of my guilds to push narratives or political standpoints either, but I digress.

Thank you for actually challenging my stories. Its not that often I get to have actual discussions without it devolving into name calling.

Just about everyone has varying reasons for joining/participating in the RCP. Some just wanted a chance to get back at milkit. Others just thought it looked liked fun. Others wanted to prove a point. Some users wanted a way to leave Ruqqus with a bang.

I personally did it to prove a point: How disastrous exclusively staying inside an echo chamber (such as the memery) is.

How much time was put into the RCP?

It varies between users, but overall most users put in a grand total of 2 hours or less. The more active RCP members (such as Carp, myself, and a couple others) put in a total of about 4 hours. So really, this wasn't a high effort campaign. Makes it all the more bizarre that people fell for it in the first place.

Notable Contributors

I did not do this all on my own. There were numerous contributors to this cause that helped make it successful. Among these notable contributors are:

@AsininePorcupine @no_chill @carpathianflorist @EmbraceTheMonke @Seq37 @acikek @kek @SomeoneAtThePhone @Bidpots @VILLAIN @freeday @notabot @Regmadan @l1terally_h1tler

As for the other RCP members, if you want to chime in to assert your association with our glorious project, go ahead.
post.title: The grand story of the RCP and the greatest troll op in Ruqqus history

post.body_html:
This is the story of the Ruqqus corrective project and its involvement in the greatest troll op in Ruqqus History. If you're too lazy or lack the brainpower to read through this, i would recommend checking out this video: https://youtu.be/xvFZjo5PgG0

If this isn't your cup of tea, downvote and move on. Unless you have some creative insults to drop other than fag, shill, tranny, retard, nig, troll, etc. I'm telling you this story for the first time, so I would at least expect some new insults for the first time. Ruqqus users are famous for their stubborn consistency and a lack of willingness to change their language or beliefs. Can you prove me wrong? Because this stubbornness to accept other opinions and unwillingness to listen to logic is what lead to this drama in the first place.

Precursor

A group of users gathered together on election day to create a revolutionary guild to troll the few other users on this site. This guild was +The_DonaId, where any dissenting opinions were banned (quite similar to a certain meme guild we all know of). As of now, it boasts 250+ members. However, these users wanted more, and they would lay the foundation for the creation of the RCP.

The Beginning

It all started out with me (@Emerald41) and a couple of other Ruqqus guildmasters leaving random quotes that were really bizarre out of context. I had the idea of taking screenshots of these out of context quotes and putting them together to post them in +TheMemery. Before I posted it however, users @carpathianflorist and @EmbraceTheMonke gave me some memes and advice to prep my alt account, @Sion321, to make the account look more trustworthy. Once the account was ready, the collage was posted, and we waited to see if anyone would fall for it.

And fall for it they did. https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5c0y/milkit-predicted-this-evidence-of-many

The post got 120+ upvotes in +TheMemery, and many people fell for it. A majority of the people that denied it in the comments were downvoted and/or banned from the guild. Overall, it was a massive success. I was considering ending it there, but other GMs seeing its success, also wanted to capitalize on this one-of-a-kind opportunity.

RCP involvement

After seeing the operation's success, user @carpathianflorist decided to create a Discord server just for trolling +TheMemery. This became the Ruqqus Corrective Project Discord server. 20+ Gms were added to this Discord, many of whom provided great contributions to the cause. Within a week, I had enough screenshots to make another collage of out of context quotes and posted them to +TheMemery again.

Once again, +TheMemery fell for it hard: https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5ee9/more-evidence-of-ahs-involvement-on

For the next part, we decided to leak the RCP server invite so that skeptics could get their own screenshots as evidence. We pretended to be clueless, but in fact, it was all a ruse to give people time to get their "evidence." Now, it was practically undeniable that the "cabal" existed since multiple users now had "evidence".

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5lsh/urgent-ccpahs-discord-link-has-been

Final Phase

After a while, we decided it was time to bring the RCP to a close. We had our fun, but we wanted to go out with a bang. Over time, we picked up even more users. The most prominent among these were devs @Seq37 & @acikek, and site admin @kek who joined a day before the finale. I asked Seq and Acikek to to DM me saying that they will deactivate Sion321 if I don't delete my previous "bombshells." I took screenshots of these DMs and created the final collage and posted them to +TheMemery

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5qyy/two-code-contributors-of-some-sort

The post sparked a lot of controversy, and @milkit (GM of +TheMemery) was suspicious. To allay his suspicions, @Seq37 gave me the idea of spamming comments in one of his private guilds to trigger the anti-spam system to ban @Sion321. Needless to say, +TheMemery freaked out, and users demanded statements from site admins for a reason why Sion was banned. Site admin @kek came in first and told the guild all about the RCP and how I intentionally got Sion321 banned by spamming. The users (including milkit) denied all of it, lashing out at Kek, calling him a liar and incompetent among other things. Very few people believed it, until site admin @captainmeta4 came in and confirmed everything Kek had said.

Edit - Adding this link: https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5r1h/so-sion123-was-threatened-with-a

The aftermath

@milkit, realizing he had been played hard, started to again lash out against the admins calling them trolls and whatnot. Desperately grasping for straws, he found an out-of-context comment by Carp saying that I was a young girl. Ironic considering all this drama was caused because of out-of-context screenshots. Using Carp's comment as evidence, milkit accused @carpathianflorist and @kek of being pedos trying to groom me.

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5rcc/omg-its-even-more-pathetic-than

I'm not gonna reveal my age, but I will say I'm older than 18, so already that claim is false. Also, neither Carp nor Kek have any romantic interest in me, and I don't have any romantic interest in them. This was just milkit's attempt to deflect attention from himself after being humiliated in his own circlejerk which we colloquially call +TheMemery.

https://i.ruqqus.com/post/5rnd/EVqVQFr2__g

Legacy of the RCP

And now we find ourselves at the present. Much of +TheMemery is still in denial and some guilds (Such as +BasedMemes) are taking precautionary measures against threats that don't even exist. We sucessfully managed to convince a good portion of the site that shills, the CCP, & AHS are active forces on Ruqqus.

However, if you take a step back, you can easily tell all of this was a grand ruse. The CCP and AHS aren't interested in an obscure forum in which Discord screenshots and 4chan posts are used as evidence. The word "shill" has been thrown around so much that its lost its meaning. The only genuine shill (by definition) on this site is that TEFL reposter.

If you want a more deep analysis of the moral of this saga, I would reccomend giving @AsininePorcupine's post a read: https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/5s60/the-difference-between-trolls-and-shills

Now that our fun is over, the RCP has decided to come to a close. The Ruqqus Corrective Project will no longer be operational. However all this begs the question...

Why did the RCP do this?

Just about everyone has varying reasons for joining/participating in the RCP. Some just wanted a chance to get back at milkit. Others just thought it looked liked fun. Others wanted to prove a point. Some users wanted a way to leave Ruqqus with a bang.

I personally did it to prove a point: How disastrous exclusively staying inside an echo chamber (such as the memery) is.

How much time was put into the RCP?

It varies between users, but overall most users put in a grand total of 2 hours or less. The more active RCP members (such as Carp, myself, and a couple others) put in a total of about 4 hours. So really, this wasn't a high effort campaign. Makes it all the more bizarre that people fell for it in the first place.

Notable Contributors

I did not do this all on my own. There were numerous contributors to this cause that helped make it successful. Among these notable contributors are:

@AsininePorcupine @no_chill @carpathianflorist @EmbraceTheMonke @Seq37 @acikek @kek @SomeoneAtThePhone @Bidpots @VILLAIN @freeday @notabot @Regmadan @l1terally_h1tler

As for the other RCP members, if you want to chime in to assert your association with our glorious project, go ahead.
post.title: The grand story of the RCP and the greatest troll op in Ruqqus history

post.body_html:
This is the story of the Ruqqus corrective project and its involvement in the greatest troll op in Ruqqus History. If you're too lazy or lack the brainpower to read through this, i would recommend checking out this video: https://youtu.be/xvFZjo5PgG0

If this isn't your cup of tea, downvote and move on. Unless you have some creative insults to drop other than fag, shill, tranny, retard, nig, troll, etc. I'm telling you this story for the first time, so I would at least expect some new insults for the first time. Ruqqus users are famous for their stubborn consistency and a lack of willingness to change their language or beliefs. Can you prove me wrong? Because this stubbornness to accept other opinions and unwillingness to listen to logic is what lead to this drama in the first place.

Precursor

A group of users gathered together on election day to create a revolutionary guild to troll the few other users on this site. This guild was +The_DonaId, where any dissenting opinions were banned (quite similar to a certain meme guild we all know of). As of now, it boasts 250+ members. However, these users wanted more, and they would lay the foundation for the creation of the RCP.

The Beginning

It all started out with me (@Emerald41) and a couple of other Ruqqus guildmasters leaving random quotes that were really bizarre out of context. I had the idea of taking screenshots of these out of context quotes and putting them together to post them in +TheMemery. Before I posted it however, users @carpathianflorist and @EmbraceTheMonke gave me some memes and advice to prep my alt account, @Sion321, to make the account look more trustworthy. Once the account was ready, the collage was posted, and we waited to see if anyone would fall for it.

And fall for it they did. https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5c0y/milkit-predicted-this-evidence-of-many

The post got 120+ upvotes in +TheMemery, and many people fell for it. A majority of the people that denied it in the comments were downvoted and/or banned from the guild. Overall, it was a massive success. I was considering ending it there, but other GMs seeing its success, also wanted to capitalize on this one-of-a-kind opportunity.

RCP involvement

After seeing the operation's success, user @carpathianflorist decided to create a Discord server just for trolling +TheMemery. This became the Ruqqus Corrective Project Discord server. 20+ Gms were added to this Discord, many of whom provided great contributions to the cause. Within a week, I had enough screenshots to make another collage of out of context quotes and posted them to +TheMemery again.

Once again, +TheMemery fell for it hard: https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5ee9/more-evidence-of-ahs-involvement-on

For the next part, we decided to leak the RCP server invite so that skeptics could get their own screenshots as evidence. We pretended to be clueless, but in fact, it was all a ruse to give people time to get their "evidence." Now, it was practically undeniable that the "cabal" existed since multiple users now had "evidence".

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5lsh/urgent-ccpahs-discord-link-has-been

Final Phase

After a while, we decided it was time to bring the RCP to a close. We had our fun, but we wanted to go out with a bang. Over time, we picked up even more users. The most prominent among these were devs @Seq37 & @acikek, and site admin @kek who joined a day before the finale. I asked Seq and Acikek to to DM me saying that they will deactivate Sion321 if I don't delete my previous "bombshells." I took screenshots of these DMs and created the final collage and posted them to +TheMemery

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5qyy/two-code-contributors-of-some-sort

The post sparked a lot of controversy, and @milkit (GM of +TheMemery) was suspicious. To allay his suspicions, @Seq37 gave me the idea of spamming comments in one of his private guilds to trigger the anti-spam system to ban @Sion321. Needless to say, +TheMemery freaked out, and users demanded statements from site admins for a reason why Sion was banned. Site admin @kek came in first and told the guild all about the RCP and how I intentionally got Sion321 banned by spamming. The users (including milkit) denied all of it, lashing out at Kek, calling him a liar and incompetent among other things. Very few people believed it, until site admin @captainmeta4 came in and confirmed everything Kek had said.

Edit - Adding this link: https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5r1h/so-sion123-was-threatened-with-a

The aftermath

@milkit, realizing he had been played hard, started to again lash out against the admins calling them trolls and whatnot. Desperately grasping for straws, he found an out-of-context comment by Carp saying that I was a young girl. Ironic considering all this drama was caused because of out-of-context screenshots. Using Carp's comment as evidence, milkit accused @carpathianflorist and @kek of being pedos trying to groom me.

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5rcc/omg-its-even-more-pathetic-than

I'm not gonna reveal my age, but I will say I'm older than 18, so already that claim is false. Also, neither Carp nor Kek have any romantic interest in me, and I don't have any romantic interest in them. This was just milkit's attempt to deflect attention from himself after being humiliated in his own circlejerk which we colloquially call +TheMemery.

https://i.ruqqus.com/post/5rnd/EVqVQFr2__g

Legacy of the RCP

And now we find ourselves at the present. Much of +TheMemery is still in denial and some guilds (Such as +BasedMemes) are taking precautionary measures against threats that don't even exist. We sucessfully managed to convince a good portion of the site that shills, the CCP, & AHS are active forces on Ruqqus.

However, if you take a step back, you can easily tell all of this was a grand ruse. The CCP and AHS aren't interested in an obscure forum in which Discord screenshots and 4chan posts are used as evidence. The word "shill" has been thrown around so much that its lost its meaning. The only genuine shill (by definition) on this site is that TEFL reposter.

If you want a more deep analysis of the moral of this saga, I would reccomend giving @AsininePorcupine's post a read: https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/5s60/the-difference-between-trolls-and-shills

Now that our fun is over, the RCP has decided to come to a close. The Ruqqus Corrective Project will no longer be operational. However all this begs the question...

Why did the RCP do this?

Just about everyone has varying reasons for joining/participating in the RCP. Some just wanted a chance to get back at milkit. Others just thought it looked liked fun. Others wanted to prove a point. Some users wanted a way to leave Ruqqus with a bang.

I personally did it to prove a point: How disastrous exclusively staying inside an echo chamber (such as the memery) is.

How much time was put into the RCP?

It varies between users, but overall most users put in a grand total of 2 hours or less. The more active RCP members (such as Carp, myself, and a couple others) put in a total of about 4 hours. So really, this wasn't a high effort campaign. Makes it all the more bizarre that people fell for it in the first place.

Notable Contributors

I did not do this all on my own. There were numerous contributors to this cause that helped make it successful. Among these notable contributors are:

@AsininePorcupine @no_chill @carpathianflorist @EmbraceTheMonke @Seq37 @acikek @kek @SomeoneAtThePhone @Bidpots @VILLAIN @freeday @notabot @Regmadan @l1terally_h1tler

As for the other RCP members, if you want to chime in to assert your association with our glorious project, go ahead.
post.title: The grand story of the RCP and the greatest troll op in Ruqqus history

body:
NGL-- I'd been avoiding a certain users guilds anyway, and having missed the initial conspiracy theories, didn't get the point of what was going on. I believe that's true of most users, those who avoid the discord, had no idea what was going on, and so the entire "joke" went over our heads. 

Thank you for this post and the clarifications.  

Which leads me to my only question at this point: When we will get an option to completely Hide those, and other guilds so we don't have to see it anymore, because despite hiding guilds, it still shows up on my "Home" tab. And a lot of it. Apparently, the only way it can present itself is to post something every 2 mins, which is irritating and causes the home page to lose many superior posts that get lost in the crush. The "All" page shows no post from that guild, but there's so much there I didn't subscribe to, it's not worth the constant scrolling. 

A a high five and a shout out to the admins and those who participated. And thanks for the chuckles.
body_html:
NGL-- I'd been avoiding a certain users guilds anyway, and having missed the initial conspiracy theories, didn't get the point of what was going on. I believe that's true of most users, those who avoid the discord, had no idea what was going on, and so the entire "joke" went over our heads.

Thank you for this post and the clarifications.

Which leads me to my only question at this point: When we will get an option to completely Hide those, and other guilds so we don't have to see it anymore, because despite hiding guilds, it still shows up on my "Home" tab. And a lot of it. Apparently, the only way it can present itself is to post something every 2 mins, which is irritating and causes the home page to lose many superior posts that get lost in the crush. The "All" page shows no post from that guild, but there's so much there I didn't subscribe to, it's not worth the constant scrolling.

A a high five and a shout out to the admins and those who participated. And thanks for the chuckles.

post.body_html:
This is the story of the Ruqqus corrective project and its involvement in the greatest troll op in Ruqqus History. If you're too lazy or lack the brainpower to read through this, i would recommend checking out this video: https://youtu.be/xvFZjo5PgG0

If this isn't your cup of tea, downvote and move on. Unless you have some creative insults to drop other than fag, shill, tranny, retard, nig, troll, etc. I'm telling you this story for the first time, so I would at least expect some new insults for the first time. Ruqqus users are famous for their stubborn consistency and a lack of willingness to change their language or beliefs. Can you prove me wrong? Because this stubbornness to accept other opinions and unwillingness to listen to logic is what lead to this drama in the first place.

Precursor

A group of users gathered together on election day to create a revolutionary guild to troll the few other users on this site. This guild was +The_DonaId, where any dissenting opinions were banned (quite similar to a certain meme guild we all know of). As of now, it boasts 250+ members. However, these users wanted more, and they would lay the foundation for the creation of the RCP.

The Beginning

It all started out with me (@Emerald41) and a couple of other Ruqqus guildmasters leaving random quotes that were really bizarre out of context. I had the idea of taking screenshots of these out of context quotes and putting them together to post them in +TheMemery. Before I posted it however, users @carpathianflorist and @EmbraceTheMonke gave me some memes and advice to prep my alt account, @Sion321, to make the account look more trustworthy. Once the account was ready, the collage was posted, and we waited to see if anyone would fall for it.

And fall for it they did. https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5c0y/milkit-predicted-this-evidence-of-many

The post got 120+ upvotes in +TheMemery, and many people fell for it. A majority of the people that denied it in the comments were downvoted and/or banned from the guild. Overall, it was a massive success. I was considering ending it there, but other GMs seeing its success, also wanted to capitalize on this one-of-a-kind opportunity.

RCP involvement

After seeing the operation's success, user @carpathianflorist decided to create a Discord server just for trolling +TheMemery. This became the Ruqqus Corrective Project Discord server. 20+ Gms were added to this Discord, many of whom provided great contributions to the cause. Within a week, I had enough screenshots to make another collage of out of context quotes and posted them to +TheMemery again.

Once again, +TheMemery fell for it hard: https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5ee9/more-evidence-of-ahs-involvement-on

For the next part, we decided to leak the RCP server invite so that skeptics could get their own screenshots as evidence. We pretended to be clueless, but in fact, it was all a ruse to give people time to get their "evidence." Now, it was practically undeniable that the "cabal" existed since multiple users now had "evidence".

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5lsh/urgent-ccpahs-discord-link-has-been

Final Phase

After a while, we decided it was time to bring the RCP to a close. We had our fun, but we wanted to go out with a bang. Over time, we picked up even more users. The most prominent among these were devs @Seq37 & @acikek, and site admin @kek who joined a day before the finale. I asked Seq and Acikek to to DM me saying that they will deactivate Sion321 if I don't delete my previous "bombshells." I took screenshots of these DMs and created the final collage and posted them to +TheMemery

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5qyy/two-code-contributors-of-some-sort

The post sparked a lot of controversy, and @milkit (GM of +TheMemery) was suspicious. To allay his suspicions, @Seq37 gave me the idea of spamming comments in one of his private guilds to trigger the anti-spam system to ban @Sion321. Needless to say, +TheMemery freaked out, and users demanded statements from site admins for a reason why Sion was banned. Site admin @kek came in first and told the guild all about the RCP and how I intentionally got Sion321 banned by spamming. The users (including milkit) denied all of it, lashing out at Kek, calling him a liar and incompetent among other things. Very few people believed it, until site admin @captainmeta4 came in and confirmed everything Kek had said.

Edit - Adding this link: https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5r1h/so-sion123-was-threatened-with-a

The aftermath

@milkit, realizing he had been played hard, started to again lash out against the admins calling them trolls and whatnot. Desperately grasping for straws, he found an out-of-context comment by Carp saying that I was a young girl. Ironic considering all this drama was caused because of out-of-context screenshots. Using Carp's comment as evidence, milkit accused @carpathianflorist and @kek of being pedos trying to groom me.

https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/5rcc/omg-its-even-more-pathetic-than

I'm not gonna reveal my age, but I will say I'm older than 18, so already that claim is false. Also, neither Carp nor Kek have any romantic interest in me, and I don't have any romantic interest in them. This was just milkit's attempt to deflect attention from himself after being humiliated in his own circlejerk which we colloquially call +TheMemery.

https://i.ruqqus.com/post/5rnd/EVqVQFr2__g

Legacy of the RCP

And now we find ourselves at the present. Much of +TheMemery is still in denial and some guilds (Such as +BasedMemes) are taking precautionary measures against threats that don't even exist. We sucessfully managed to convince a good portion of the site that shills, the CCP, & AHS are active forces on Ruqqus.

However, if you take a step back, you can easily tell all of this was a grand ruse. The CCP and AHS aren't interested in an obscure forum in which Discord screenshots and 4chan posts are used as evidence. The word "shill" has been thrown around so much that its lost its meaning. The only genuine shill (by definition) on this site is that TEFL reposter.

If you want a more deep analysis of the moral of this saga, I would reccomend giving @AsininePorcupine's post a read: https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/5s60/the-difference-between-trolls-and-shills

Now that our fun is over, the RCP has decided to come to a close. The Ruqqus Corrective Project will no longer be operational. However all this begs the question...

Why did the RCP do this?

Just about everyone has varying reasons for joining/participating in the RCP. Some just wanted a chance to get back at milkit. Others just thought it looked liked fun. Others wanted to prove a point. Some users wanted a way to leave Ruqqus with a bang.

I personally did it to prove a point: How disastrous exclusively staying inside an echo chamber (such as the memery) is.

How much time was put into the RCP?

It varies between users, but overall most users put in a grand total of 2 hours or less. The more active RCP members (such as Carp, myself, and a couple others) put in a total of about 4 hours. So really, this wasn't a high effort campaign. Makes it all the more bizarre that people fell for it in the first place.

Notable Contributors

I did not do this all on my own. There were numerous contributors to this cause that helped make it successful. Among these notable contributors are:

@AsininePorcupine @no_chill @carpathianflorist @EmbraceTheMonke @Seq37 @acikek @kek @SomeoneAtThePhone @Bidpots @VILLAIN @freeday @notabot @Regmadan @l1terally_h1tler

As for the other RCP members, if you want to chime in to assert your association with our glorious project, go ahead.
post.title: The grand story of the RCP and the greatest troll op in Ruqqus history

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

How much time was put into the RCP?

It varies between users, but overall most users put in a grand total of 2 hours or less. The more active RCP members (such as Carp, myself, and a couple others) put in a total of about 4 hours. So really, this wasn't a high effort campaign. Makes it all the more bizarre that people fell for it in the first place.

Notable Contributors

I did not do this all on my own. There were numerous contributors to this cause that helped make it successful. Among these notable contributors are:

@AsininePorcupine @no_chill @carpathianflorist @EmbraceTheMonke @Seq37 @acikek @kek @SomeoneAtThePhone @Bidpots @VILLAIN @freeday @notabot @Regmadan @l1terally_h1tler

As for the other RCP members, if you want to chime in to assert your association with our glorious project, go ahead.
